# Cloud Architecture Center - Manage Active Directory connections
Last reviewed 2023-04-05 UTC
The following file sharing protocols rely on external directory services to provide user identity information:
- SMB (CIFS)
- NFSv3 with extended groups
- NFSv4
Cloud Volumes Service for Google Cloud relies on Microsoft Active Directory for directory services.
Active Directory provides services including an LDAP server for looking up objects, a DNS server to resolve hostnames, and a Kerberos server for authentication. Objects include:
- Users
- Groups
- Machine accounts
For best practices, see [DNS recommendations](/compute/docs/instances/windows/best-practices#use_cloud_dns_private_forwarding_zones) .
For more information on Active Directory, see [Active Directory: Design Considerations and Best Practices](https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/52587.active-directory-design-considerations-and-best-practices.aspx)
